name: Result
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
Table
AsyncInserter
Result
description:
AsyncInserter::Result

Represents the result from BigQuery, including any error encountered, when data is asynchronously inserted into a table for near-immediate querying. See Dataset#insert_async and Table#insert_async.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"
table = dataset.table "my_table"
inserter = table.insert_async do |result|
  if result.error?
    log_error result.error
  else
    log_insert "inserted #{result.insert_count} rows " \
      "with #{result.error_count} errors"
  end
end

rows = [
  { "first_name" => "Alice", "age" => 21 },
  { "first_name" => "Bob", "age" => 22 }
]
inserter.insert rows

inserter.stop.wait!

methods.name: insert_response
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
Table
AsyncInserter
Result#insert_response
methods.description: The response from the insert operation if no error was encountered, or nil if the insert operation encountered an error.

methods.name: error
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
Table
AsyncInserter
Result#error
methods.description: The error from the insert operation if any error was encountered, otherwise nil.

methods.name: error?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
Table
AsyncInserter
Result#error?
methods.description: Checks if an error is present, meaning that the insert operation encountered an error. Use #error to access the error. For row-level errors, see #success? and #insert_errors.

returns.description: true when an error is present, false otherwise.

methods.name: success?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
Table
AsyncInserter
Result#success?
methods.description: Checks if the error count for row-level errors is zero, meaning that all of the rows were inserted. Use #insert_errors to access the row-level errors. To check for and access any operation-level error, use #error? and #error.

returns.description: true when the error count is zero, false when the error count is positive, or nil if the insert operation encountered an error.

methods.name: insert_count
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
Table
AsyncInserter
Result#insert_count
methods.description: The count of rows in the response, minus the count of errors for rows that were not inserted.

returns.description: The number of rows inserted, or nil if the insert operation encountered an error.

methods.name: error_count
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
Table
AsyncInserter
Result#error_count
methods.description: The count of errors for rows that were not inserted.

returns.description: The number of errors, or nil if the insert operation encountered an error.

methods.name: insert_errors
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
Table
AsyncInserter
Result#insert_errors
methods.description: The error objects for rows that were not inserted.

returns.description: An array containing error objects, or nil if the insert operation encountered an error.
An array of hash objects containing the row data, or nil if the insert operation encountered an error.

methods.name: insert_error_for
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
Table
AsyncInserter
Result#insert_error_for
methods.description: Returns the error object for a row that was not inserted.

params.name: row
params.description: A hash containing the data for a row.

returns.description: An error object, nil if no error is found in the response for the row, or nil if the insert operation encountered an error.

methods.name: errors_for
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
Table
AsyncInserter
Result#errors_for
methods.description: Returns the error hashes for a row that was not inserted. Each error hash contains the following keys: reason, location, debugInfo, and message.

params.name: row
params.description: A hash containing the data for a row.

returns.description: An array of error hashes, nil if no errors are found in the response for the row, or nil if the insert operation encountered an error.

methods.name: index_for
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
Table
AsyncInserter
Result#index_for
methods.description: Returns the index for a row that was not inserted.

params.name: row
params.description: A hash containing the data for a row.

returns.description: An error object, nil if no error is found in the response for the row, or nil if the insert operation encountered an error.
